content: The last validator input contained an extra space character at the end which caused some solutions to break, I went ahead and removed that.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: le défi est sympa et bonne description

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle

Nice easy puzzle Your test cases are restricted to upper case characters, but it is not yet in the input constraints. Neither is the maximum number of characters per word.
I am also missing the position starts at 1 and all positions are present, such that the result is actually a word.

It's an interesting puzzle.

I recommend that you specify in the Constraints that the characters will only be letters, or at least will not contain numeric digits (since then it would be much harder to decide whether it's character+position or position+character.

I also recommend that the tests/validators progress through difficulty. For example:
First test: Always position+letter, words shorter than 10 characters, all characters unique within a word.
Second test: Mix of position+letter and letter+position
Third test: Words longer than 10 characters
Fourth test: Same letter appears multiple times in a word

Thanks for the feedback.Yeah, the input have a upper-case character and its position and not completely numeric as its difficult to conclude. Also, I made some changes in the test cases and now its in order of difficulty.
Thanks for the feedback.I have modified the constraints now and yes,the input always consists of all the positions.
